column5: The best #custexp leaders know how to listen & respond. Feedback from customers and employees is like oxygen. Your organization must have it to survive and thrive. This @LI_learning video identifies four steps for an effective VOC approach.  https://t.co/UaRU54MIKg #custexp #cctr

The discipline of #custexp wouldn’t exist without access to large amounts of data. But the many experiences across multiple touchpoints can lead CX professionals to throw their hands up.  Multi-layered dashboards can help you cut through clutter. #custserv https://t.co/A3TCfaHK8k https://t.co/q04NxRZZWI
@iamfra5er @AKASpencerScott @median Thank you both. I'm blushing a bit. Good to connect here.

This month's Edge of Service newsletter features an interview with Bill Price. He & David Jaffe believe that customer contacts provide insight into reducing #custexp friction — a view I’ve long shared. #custserv #cctr
https://t.co/fPqZdgtV1R https://t.co/htv1tsFZpW

Everything to do with getting resources right in a #cctr begins with forecasting. It pays off in more accurate schedules and budgets, and in better #custserv. Watch my @LI_learning video to learn more. #custexp https://t.co/SLsPPWfWgk

The technologies powering today’s world, along with evolving customer expectations, are changing the nature of #custserv. Many leaders are wondering where the trends are taking us. Will the fundamentals of #cctr management still apply? #custexp https://t.co/l12YqJhEHM

Focusing on #custserv improvements at the process level is so powerful. I once did some work for a company that provides software packages for businesses. A lot of things were going right, but their director had some concerns. https://t.co/PaRcllLNjJ #custexp #cctr

Would you go to a game and wait until your team won to cheer? Consistently delivering great #custexp takes focus, work & unwavering commitment. Celebrating progress along the way is essential... https://t.co/kiZfMIM27x #custserv #cctr
Thank you for the work you are doing, @in_queue, it was a privilege being part of the podcast this week.

Regardless of your organization's size or industry, you need a customer access strategy that defines how you will interact with customers.  An effective CAS has 10 components. Learn more in this @LI_learning video. https://t.co/kFUHJiGiOu #custserv #cctr #custexp https://t.co/JNNfVbQGsO

Customer advocacy is more than just a “project” or “initiative” of its own. Instead it is an ingredient—it’s the secret sauce to add a delightful complement to a recipe you already have. Read more here https://t.co/Ty5cVP2quo #custexp #custserv #cctr https://t.co/GJULfcH6bf

Customer-centric organizations spend more time designing processes & less time getting better at appeasing unhappy customers. They devote their attention to eliminating what makes customers unhappy in the first place. #custexp #custserv #cctr
https://t.co/5ipMiC9kIr

In #custserv, queues are a fact of life—especially now, given staffing shortages & growing workloads. Answering every contact immediately would take as many staff as inbound contacts at any given moment. So, how do customers perceive queues? https://t.co/52j7h7eCLE #cctr #custexp
